title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 1101.3 - Scope of practice for a licensed residential real estate appraiser
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 1101.3 - Scope of practice for a licensed residential real estate appraiser

State Regulations
(a) The scope of
practice for a licensed residential real estate appraiser is limited to the
appraisal of non-complex 1-4 family residential units having a transaction
value of less than $1,000,000 and complex 1-4 family residential units having a
transaction value of less than $250,000. (b) The scope of practice for a licensed
residential real estate appraiser includes the appraisal of vacant or
unimproved land that is to be utilized for a 1-4 family residential unit or
vacant or unimproved land for which the highest and best use is a 1-4 family
residential unit. In either case, the scope of practice is limited to the
appraisal of vacant or unimproved land having a transaction value of less than
$1,000,000. Notes

1101.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
